name: Determining whether two ratios are proportional

skills.name: Recognise graphical representations of direct proportion in the form y = kx
Recognise if two ratios are equivalent
Identify a ratio from a linear graph
Identify a ratio from a table of values

explanations.A: The numbers in one ratio being the square roots of the numbers in a second ratio does not make them equivalent. To be equivalent they need to simplify to the same ratio. Ratios (1) and (2) are both already in their simplest form and are not the same, so Tom is not correct. Simplify (3) 6:12, to check if Katie is correct.
explanations.B: To be equivalent, ratios need to simplify to the same ratio. 4:9 is in its simplest form. If we simplify 6:12 by dividing both numbers by 6 we get 1:2, which is not equivalent to 4:9, so Katie is not correct. Now check Tom's...
explanations.C: Ratios are equivalent if they are the same when you write them in their simplest form. Ratio (1) 4:9, is already in its simplest form as there is no number that both 4 and 9 can be divided by. Check ratios (2) and (3), simplify them if possible and see if any are equivalent.
explanations.D: Ratios 4:9 and 2:3 are already in their simplest form. Ratio 6:12 simplifies to 1:2. As none of these simplified ratios are the same there are no equivalent ratios in the question so both Tom and Katie are incorrect.

explanations.A: Ratio (1) 8:6, simplifies to 4:3 which is the same as ratio (2). Ratio (3) 64:36 can be simplified by dividing by 4 to give 16:9. So Tom is correct that (1) and (2) are equivalent, but Katie is not correct.
explanations.B: The numbers in ratio (3) are the squares of the numbers in ratio (1) but that does not make them equivalent. Simplify (1) 8:6, by dividing both sides by 2. Simplify (3) by dividing both sides by 4. Then compare the three ratios. To be equivalent they need to simplify to the same ratio.
explanations.C: The numbers in one ratio being the square roots of the numbers in a second ratio does not make them equivalent. To be equivalent they need to simplify to the same ratio. For example we can simplify 8:6 by dividing both sides by 2. Simplify all the ratios and then compare them.
explanations.D: To be equivalent ratios need to simplify to the same ratio. For example we can simplify 8:6 by dividing both sides by 2. Simplify all the ratios and then compare them.
